greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{m>=1} (1-m*q^m)^27.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
mathematica: With[{nmax = 50}, CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1 - k*q^k)^27, {k, 1, nmax}], {q, 0, nmax}], q]] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 19 2018 *)
program: (PARI) m=50; q='q+O('q^m); Vec(prod(n=1,m,(1-n*q^n)^27)) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 19 2018
(MAGMA) Coefficients(&*[(1-m*x^m)^27:m in [1..40]])[1..40] where x is PolynomialRing(Integers()).1; // _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 19 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
